paper_abstract: We present a low-power bandgap reference (BGR), functional from sub-1 V to 5 V supply voltage with either a low dropout (LDO) regulator or source follower (SF) output stage, denoted as the LDO or SF mode, in a 0.5-mu m standard digital CMOS process with V-tn approximate to 0.6 V and vertical bar V-tp vertical bar approximate to 0.7 V at 27 degrees C. Both modes operate at sub-1 V under zero load with a power consumption of around 26 mu W. At 1 V (1.1 V) supply, the LDO (SF) mode provides an output current up to 1.1 mA (0.35 mA), a load regulation of +/- 8.5 mV/mA (+/- 33 mV/mA) with approximately 10 mu s transient, a line regulation of +/- 4.2 mV/V (+/- 50 mu V/V), and a temperature compensated reference voltage of 0.228 V (0.235 V) with a temperature coefficient around 34 ppm/degrees C from -20 degrees C to 120 degrees C. At 1.5 V supply, the LDO (SF) mode can further drive up to 9.6 mA (3.2 mA) before the reference voltage falls to 90% of its nominal value. Such low-supply-voltage and high-current-driving BGR in standard digital CMOS processes is highly useful in portable and switching applications.
paper_title: A Sub-1 V, 26 mu W, Low-Output-Impedance CMOS Bandgap Reference With a Low Dropout or Source Follower Mode
